dragosmg opened a new pull request, #13162:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/13162

   This PR will reduce the number of times `lintr::lint_package()` is being run to 1. Currently it runs on each branch of the Windows CI workflows.

thisisnic commented on PR #13162:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/13162#issuecomment-1127553357

   Thanks - this looks good.  Before I approve this, any idea why the workflow you edited hasn't run here?  Not sure if the CI is a little behind or something else?

dragosmg commented on PR #13162:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/13162#issuecomment-1127557391

   I have no idea. Judging by the workflow file, it should:
   ```
   on:
     push:
       paths:
         - ".github/workflows/r.yml"
        ...
     pull_request:
       paths:
         - ".github/workflows/r.yml"
   ```

assignUser commented on PR #13162:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/13162#issuecomment-1127575202

   It didn't run because it's broken: https://github.com/apache/arrow/actions/runs/2331023570
   The issue are the double quotes, replace them with single quotes and this should work as expected (see [docs](https://docs.github.com/en/actions/learn-github-actions/expressions#literals))

thisisnic closed pull request #13162: ARROW-16541: [R] [CI] Reduce the number of times lintr is run

issuetype.description: An improvement or enhancement to an existing feature or task.
issuetype.name: Improvement

fields.description:
Currently {{lintr}} is being run multiple times (on several R versions), with each run taking somewhere around 5-7 minutes (on occasion longer).

Would it make sense to:
* run lintr once
* speed up the installation of {{lintr}} dependencies via caching and / or using {{pak::pkg_install()}}.
fields.summary: [R] [CI] Reduce the number of times lintr is run

comments.body: It's running multiple times because it's on the Windows GHA workflow, which is parametrized, right? Seems like we just need to add an {{if}} to that step and have it only run on one of them.
